conclusion: Determine if gas absorbs or releases heat from A to B in Stirling cycle.
Process A to B is isothermal; temperature remains constant.
In isothermal processes, work done by gas: W = nRT ln(Vf/Vi).
Work done is positive if gas expands, negative if contracts.
In P-V diagram, A to B shows gas expanding (volume increases).
Work done by gas is positive as volume increases from A to B.
First law: Q = ΔU + W; ΔU = 0 in isothermal process.
Heat absorbed (Q) equals work done (W) since ΔU = 0.
Gas absorbs heat moving from A to B.
